Dialogue.NPCText:
Before you stands a diminutive woman in a flowing, ink-brushed kimono. Her face is hidden behind an exquisitely carved mask: a fox’s smile, with shadows dancing in the eye-slits.

“Welcome, soul of many faces… I am Naoko, artisan of masks. Tell me—do you come to hide your spirit, to reveal it… or to bargain for its secrets?”

Option.text: Tell me about these masks you craft.
I seek a mask—what price do you ask?
Why do you always wear a mask?
What do you mean, 'spirits of the mask'?
Who were you before you became the Maskmaker?

Dialogue.NPCText:
Naoko gestures to a rack of masks, each unique.

“A mask is more than a face. It is a vessel for memory, courage, sorrow, or joy. I weave old spirits into my work—sometimes they murmur guidance, sometimes riddles. Wear a mask, and you may gain strength… but never without a price.”
She tilts her head. “Would you dare try one on?”

“Each mask grants a blessing—some strength, some cunning, some insight. Yet every mask holds memories from a past wearer: a lost samurai, a mourning widow, a cunning thief. Sometimes, you may hear their whispers… If you listen closely, perhaps you will learn.”
She leans in. “But beware: too long beneath a mask, and you may forget which face is truly yours.”

Option.text: Show me what masks you offer.
Can you make a custom mask?
Why would someone want such a thing?

Dialogue.NPCText:
Naoko’s masked eyes narrow with amusement.
“I can craft for you a mask of power—if you bring me the right materials… and offer a drop of your spirit.”

“Will you provide a fox pelt for cleverness, a crimson feather for courage, or a moon lotus for wisdom? Or, perhaps, you wish to purchase a simple mask—unbound, but free of spirits.”

Option.text: I have a fox pelt for cleverness.
I have a crimson feather for courage.
I have a moon lotus for wisdom.
Show me simple masks for sale.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“I have masks for those wary of spirits: fox, oni, tengu, and more. Each crafted with skill—no voices, only a touch of luck. Speak with me again to purchase.”
She lowers her voice, “But remember: true power asks a greater price.”

Naoko’s masked face inclines thoughtfully.
“Describe your wish, and leave a token—perhaps a lock of hair, a cherished trinket, or a fragment of your dream. If your spirit is strong, the mask will take shape in days to come.”
“Do you wish to leave a token now?”

Option.text: I’d like to order a custom mask.
Option.action: SendMessage:Naoko accepts your token and begins her mysterious work.

Dialogue.NPCText: “Return in three days’ time. The mask will call your spirit when it is ready.”

Naoko deftly carves a fox-faced mask, painting its eyes with silver ink. As she ties it for you, you feel a brief rush of cleverness—and a faint, sly laugh in your ear.
You gain a burst of Intelligence and Stealth for one hour.
But sometimes, at night, you may hear the mask whisper secrets about your friends...

Option.action: SendMessage:The mask tingles with secret knowledge.

Dialogue.NPCText:
She presses the crimson feather into lacquer, shaping a fierce oni visage. The mask warms in your hands—filling you with borrowed courage.
You gain a burst of Strength and Resist Magic for one hour.
Sometimes, you may feel a battle-fury not your own, and strange dreams of ancient wars…

Option.action: SendMessage:The mask’s spirit drums in your blood.

Dialogue.NPCText:
She shapes the moon lotus into a tranquil Noh mask, traced with gentle blue lines. A chill serenity settles over you.
You gain a burst of Mana and Magic Insight for one hour.
But you may occasionally speak in riddles, as if another’s wisdom borrows your tongue…

Option.action: SendMessage:Your mind tingles with borrowed wisdom.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Naoko lowers her voice.
“Masks remember those who wore them. Sometimes, the brave. Sometimes, the vengeful… The spirit you carry may help you—or haunt you. Beware which voices you heed. The mask gives, but also asks.”

Option.text: Have you ever been haunted, Naoko?
I would risk it for power.

Dialogue.NPCText:
She is silent a long moment.
“Yes. I once wore a mask too long, and when I removed it, my own voice did not return for many years. So now, I never remove this one. Perhaps, I am safer… or perhaps, I am lost.”

Option.text: I want to try a mask anyway.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Naoko’s hands tighten on her kimono sleeve.
“Some wear a mask to hide. I wear mine to protect—myself and others. When you live with many spirits, it is wiser not to show your true face… not even to yourself.”

She shrugs, softly.
“Regret? Sometimes. But this way, I remember every face I have ever worn. In my work, memory is a gift—and a curse.”

Option.text: I must be on my way.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Naoko stands still, as if surprised by the question. Her voice, when it comes, is quiet.

“Long ago, I was Naoko of the House of Falling Leaves… an artisan of the Tokuno archipelago. I carved beauty from wood and bone, but never masks. Not until… the fire.”

She turns slightly. “Do you truly wish to know? Few ask. Fewer listen.”

Option.text: If it pains you, I will not press.

Dialogue.NPCText: She nods. “Respect is a rare gift. Perhaps someday I’ll return it.”

“The House of Falling Leaves was noble once—guardians of forest spirits, stewards of shrine magic.”
“Minax shattered it.”

“She sent her agents with fire and steel. We were warned, but we hesitated. We believed our rituals would shield us. I survived… barely.”

“All I could save were my hands, my tools, and one mask—my sister’s. I wear it still.”

Option.text: Was your sister lost in the fire?
Is that the spirit whispering through your mask?
I am sorry you endured such loss.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Naoko nods once.

“She did not scream. I remember that. She looked at me and said, ‘Remember me without sorrow.’”
“I could not.”

“So I carved her face in sacred cedar… and the spirit found me. She does not speak often. But sometimes, she sings.”
She pauses. “Would you… like to hear her?”

Option.text: Yes. Let me hear her voice.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Naoko closes her eyes.
For a moment, there is silence… then a single note, like a whisper over strings, fills your ears. A lullaby in an unknown tongue.

You feel a presence—gentle, watching.
When the sound fades, Naoko speaks.
“She says you walk with kindness. Perhaps she is right.”

Naoko tilts her head. “You are wise to ask. Yes—this mask is hers. Her spirit guards me. Warns me. Sometimes… argues with me.”

“But there are times her memories rise stronger than mine. I once awoke speaking words I never learned.”
“That is why I warn others. A mask is not clothing. It is a doorway.”

Option.text: How do you live with such voices?
Can I speak to your sister?

Dialogue.NPCText:
“I live one carving at a time.”
“When I make a mask, I choose which voice to carry. My sister taught me that. Even silence is a voice.”

She bows her head briefly. “I am grateful for your questions.”

Option.text: You honor her with your work.
I still want to hear her.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Naoko’s hand brushes her mask.

“You may try… but be warned. Spirits are not commanded—they consent.”

She places a carved charm in your hand. “Wear this. If she wishes, she will find you in dreams.”

Option.action: SendMessage:A strange warmth lingers from the charm...

Dialogue.NPCText:
“In a world torn by shadow and ambition, it is rare to be heard.”
“May your path be guided not by strength, but by remembrance.”
